author: Gino D'Acampo
method: Preheat the oven to 180C/350F/Gas 4. Slice a thin slice off the bottom of the tomatoes so they sit flat on the work surface. Slice off the top, then spoon out the flesh to make a hollow 'cup' shape. Reserve the flesh. Place the hollowed tomatoes onto a baking sheet and drizzle over the honey.  Mix the Stilton with the scooped out tomato flesh, then use the mixture to stuff the tomatoes. Drizzle over the olive oil and bake in the oven for 5-6 minutes, or until the stuffing is golden-brown.  To serve, transfer the tomatoes onto serving plates and scatter over the chopped walnuts.
ingredients: 2 large tomatoes,  2 tbsp honey,  85g/3oz Stilton cheese,  1 tbsp olive oil,  25g/1oz walnuts, chopped
